We (6328) construct all of our autos relative to well-defined field coordinates. Our FieldConstants class includes the dimensions/coordinates of the major field elements relative to the right side of the blue alliance wall. More details here:

FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2023 Build Thread Open Alliance
Mini Software Update #1: Field Constants & Coordinate Systems Wow, what a thrilling way to kick things off. /s Before we get too deep into software development, we want to take a moment to share our updated FieldConstants class for 2023. It has a collection of useful constants describing the layout of most elements on the field, including: Dimensions and shapes of all regions (community, charging station, loading zone, cable bump) Positions and heights of all nodes for alignment Positions of …
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-14T22:03:16.903Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":203.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":430295,"topic_slug":"2023-field-object-coordinates","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Mechanical-Advantage/RobotCode2023/blob/main/src/main/java/org/littletonrobotics/frc2023/FieldConstants.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"RobotCode2023/FieldConstants.java at main · Mechanical-Advantage/RobotCode2023 · GitHub","clicks":39},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-6328-mechanical-advantage-2023-build-thread/420691/7","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2023 Build Thread","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/2023-field-object-coordinates/430295/5","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3164832,"name":"Roger","username":"Roger","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/c0e974/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T23:23:26.228Z","cooked":"

In the Charged Up Season Materials web page, under Playing Field Assets, is the Layout & Marking Diagram. The 4th page of that PDF has the April Tags field coordinates, the origin is on the Blue Alliance side nearest the Scoring Table.

Other pages have more dimensions, mostly the tape lines, which go around some of the major pieces. Note that numbers in (parenthesis) are approximate. Other than going to the CAD drawing or diving into the 400 or so field construction drawings (not recommended), the PDF above is the quick and easy way to dimension the field.

If you need exact numbers, there is only one way: measure the Field you are competing on.

We built this Landmarks class with has Pose2ds for all the AprilTags, each grid & their nodes, and the staging marks for game pieces during auto:
Landmarks.java (6.8 KB)

The file uses the coordinate system FIRST defines in the Layout & Marking Diagram.
